lead_paragraph: Negotiations to restructure about $9 billion of the debt of Puerto Rico’s power company collapsed, raising the prospect of the biggest default yet in the island’s debt crisis.

headline.print_headline: Failed Talks Raise Specter of Biggest Default in Puerto Rico Crisis
headline.main: Failed Talks Raise Specter of Biggest Default in Puerto Rico Crisis

snippet: Negotiations to restructure about $9 billion of the debt of Puerto Rico’s power company collapsed, raising the prospect of the biggest default yet in the island’s debt crisis.
abstract: Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority and its creditors fail to negotiate terms to restructure payment for about $9 billion of agency's debt; Prepa is one of largest contributor's to commonwealth's total debt of $72 billion, most of which is in form of municipal bonds; potential default would be largest in Puerto Rico's worsening debt crisis.
